contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox album <!-- See Wikipedia:WikiProject_Albums --> | Name = Daylight | Type = EP | Artist = [[Aesop Rock]] | Cover = AesopRockDaylight.jpg | Released = 5 February 2002 | Recorded = | | Genre = [[Hip hop music|Hip hop]] | Length = 37:25 | Label = [[Definitive Jux]]<br /><small>DJX021</small> | Producer = [[Aesop Rock]]<br />[[Blockhead (music)|Blockhead]]<br />[[Blueprint (rapper)|Blueprint]]<br />[[El-P]] | Last album = ''[[Labor Days]]''<br />(2001)| | This album = '''''Daylight'''''<br />(2002)| | Next album = ''[[Bazooka Tooth]]''<br />(2003)| }} {{Album reviews | rev1 = [[Allmusic]] | rev1score = {{Rating|2.5|5}}<ref>[{{Allmusic|class=album|id=r572085|pure_url=yes}} link]</ref> | rev2 = [[Robert Christgau]] | rev2score = {{Rating-Christgau|A-}}<ref name="Christgau">{{cite web |last=Christgau |first=Robert |url=http://www.robertchristgau.com/get_album.php?id=11083 |title=Daylight |publisher=[[Robert Christgau]] |date= |accessdate= }}</ref> | rev3 = HipHopDX | rev3score = {{Rating|4.5|5}}<ref>[http://www.hiphopdx.com/index/reviews/id.145/title.aesop-rock-daylight link]</ref> | rev4 = [[Stylus Magazine]] | rev4Score = A−<ref>[http://www.stylusmagazine.com/reviews/aesop-rock/daylight-ep.htm link]</ref> | noprose = yes }} '''''Daylight''''' is an [[Extended play|EP]] by [[United States|American]] [[hip hop music|hip hop]] artist [[Aesop Rock]], released on 5 February 2002 on [[Definitive Jux]]. It is also the title of a [[Single (music)|single]] from his second major album, ''[[Labor Days]]''. The song is included on the EP, along with a reworking entitled "Night Light." The album makes an appearance in the film [[The Life Before Her Eyes]] in one of the flashback sequences.<ref>[http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=lXzWxHuU0uQ&feature=player_detailpage#t=1m12s The.Life.Before.Her.Eyes.Part.5 - YouTube]</ref> ==Track listing== #"Daylight" – 4:25 #*Producer: [[Blockhead (music)|Blockhead]] #"Night Light" – 4:17 #*Producer: Blockhead #"Nickel Plated Pockets" – 4:31 #*Additional vocals: [[Vast Aire]] #*Producer: [[El-P]] #"Alchemy" – 4:24 #*Featuring [[Blueprint (rapper)|Blueprint]] #*Producer: Blueprint #"Forest Crunk" – 4:39 #*Producer: Blockhead #"Bracket Basher" – 5:38 #*Producer: Blockhead #*Samples "Iron Galaxy" by [[Cannibal Ox]] #"Maintenance" – 4:22 #*Producer: Blockhead #"One of Four (Thank You)" (hidden track) – 5:09 #*Producer: [[Aesop Rock]] == References == {{reflist}} ==External links== *[http://www.definitivejux.net/ Definitive Jux Website] {{Definitive Jux Records}} [[Category:2002 EPs]] [[Category:Aesop Rock albums]] [[Category:Albums produced by Aesop Rock]] [[Category:Definitive Jux EPs]]
